title: Income as a determinant of demand

content.description: The diagram above shows two demand curves for video games identified as <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>D</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mstyle mathvariant="normal"> <mrow> <mi>D</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following changes will most likely cause a shift of the demand curve from <math alttext="D 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="D 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> as shown in the diagram?

choices.label: An increase in consumers’ income, assuming that video games are a normal good
An increase in the price of game consoles, a complementary good
A decrease in the price of mobile games, a substitute good
A decrease in the number of buyers in the market
A decrease in the price of video games

content.answer: An increase in consumers’ income, assuming that video games are a normal good

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
